feature_documentation_template.title: Feature Documentation Template
feature_documentation_template.description: > This template provides a standardized structure for documenting features. Use this template to ens...
feature_documentation_template.content: > This template provides a standardized structure for documenting features. Use this template to ensure consistent, comprehensive feature documentation that follows AI optimization patterns.

ai_metadata.title: AI Metadata
ai_metadata.description:
**Template Version:** 2.1
**AI Processing Level:** High
**Required Context:** Project architecture, ...
ai_metadata.content:
**Template Version:** 2.1
**AI Processing Level:** High
**Required Context:** Project architecture, existing patterns, technical summaries
**Validation Required:** Yes
**Code Generation:** Supported

**Dependencies:**
- `../project_context/architecture_overview.json.replace(".json", ".json")` - System architecture
- `../project_context/common_patterns.json.replace(".json", ".json")` - Project patterns
- `../project_context/development_workflow.json.replace(".json", ".json")` - Development process
- `../technical_summaries/` - Module details
- `../guide_docs/core_principles.json.replace(".json", ".json")` - Decision frameworks

**Validation Rules:**
- All placeholders must be replaced with specific content
- File paths must reference actual codebase structure
- Requirements must be measurable and testable
- Implementation plan must reference existing patterns
- Success criteria must be quantifiable

overview.title: Overview
overview.content:
**Feature Name:** [Name of the feature]
**Status:** [Draft/In Progress/Completed/Deprecated]
**Priority:** [High/Medium/Low]
**Target Release:** [Version number or sprint]

**AI Context:** This section establishes the feature identity and scope. Use consistent naming conventions from existing features.

description.description:

description.content:
[Provide a clear and concise description of the feature or enhancement]

**AI Guidance**: Be specific about what the feature does, who uses it, and what problem it solves. Reference existing features for similar patterns.

This description should inform the implementation plan and user stories.

Each benefit should be measurable or observable.

- **Models**: [List specific model files like `cream_api/stock_data/models.py`]

- **Frontend**: [List specific component directories and patterns]

**AI Guidance**: Reference actual files and modules from the codebase. Use `../project_context/architecture_overview.json.replace(".json", ".json")` for context.

This analysis will determine which files need to be created or modified.

All listed files and modules must exist in the codebase.

non_functional_requirements.title: Non-Functional Requirements
non_functional_requirements.content:
- **Performance**: [Specific metrics like "API response time < 200ms"]
- **Security**: [Specific security requirements like "Rate limiting: 10 requests/minute"]
- **Scalability**: [Specific scalability requirements like "Support 1000 concurrent users"]
- **Compatibility**: [Specific compatibility requirements like "Works with existing auth system"]

**AI Guidance**: Use measurable, specific requirements. Reference existing performance patterns.

These requirements will inform technical considerations and testing strategy.

All requirements must be measurable or verifiable.

**AI Quality Checklist**: Before completing this template, ensure:
- [ ] All placeholders are replaced with specific, actionable content
- [ ] File paths and module names reference actual codebase structure
- [ ] Requirements are specific and testable
- [ ] Implementation plan references existing patterns
- [ ] Success criteria are measurable
- [ ] All sections are complete and consistent
- [ ] Code generation hints are actionable
- [ ] Validation rules are satisfied
- [ ] Dependencies are properly referenced

core_implementation.title: Core Implementation
core_implementation.description:
- **Primary Logic**: [Describe the main implementation approach]
- **Data Flow**: [Explain how data ...

- **Primary Logic**: [Describe the main implementation approach]
- **Data Flow**: [Explain how data moves through the system]
- **Integration Points**: [List where this feature connects to other systems]
- **Error Handling**: [Detail error handling strategies]
- **Performance Considerations**: [Note any performance implications]

ai_script_development.title: AI Script Development
ai_script_development.description:
- **Purpose**: [Describe the script's purpose for AI consumption]
  - What problem does this script ...
ai_script_development.content:
- **Purpose**: [Describe the script's purpose for AI consumption]
  - What problem does this script solve?
  - How does it improve AI tool consumption?
  - What insights does it provide?
- **Inputs**: [List expected inputs and their formats]
  - File paths, configuration files, command-line arguments
  - Data formats, validation requirements, optional parameters
- **Outputs**: [Describe both console and file outputs]
  - Console output for immediate feedback during execution
  - Markdown reports with AI metadata and cross-references
  - JSON output for programmatic consumption and analysis
- **Error Handling**: [Detail error handling and reporting strategies]
  - Try/except blocks with comprehensive error collection
  - Error categorization (critical issues vs. warnings)
  - Resolution suggestions and actionable recommendations
- **Testing**: [Include test scripts and validation methods]
  - Unit tests for individual functions and methods
  - Integration tests for end-to-end functionality
  - Validation scripts to verify output quality
- **Maintenance**: [Document update and maintenance procedures]
  - How to update the script when requirements change
  - How to extend functionality without breaking existing features
  - How to maintain consistency with other AI scripts

This section will inform AI script development and maintenance throughout the project.

AI scripts must include all required sections and follow established patterns.
